channel.title: [TUT] How to run RSCDEF [TUT]
channel.description:
Alright, I am going to show you how to run RSCDEF released by ephemeral
Step 1) Compile the server.
Goto RSCDEF\rscdef\server_dist\bin
You should end up to a screen that looks something like this.
[IMG]http://i37.tinypic.com/fkru2u.jpg[/img]
In here is where you compile and run your server.
Goto the operating system that you are using OR you can goto apache-ant if you have ant downloaded and extracted. (Environmental Variables needs to be set)
Now, go ahead and compile the server.
[IMG]http://i37.tinypic.com/snfm8g.jpg[/img]
Step 2) Run the server.
After you are done compiling, hit run.
The server should look something like this.
[IMG]http://i37.tinypic.com/2d0gqw0.jpg[/img]
Step 3) Change the ip of the client.
Ok, goto RSCDEF\rscdef\client_dist\res
[IMG]http://i34.tinypic.com/2vkfhj9.jpg[/img]
Open "settings.ini"
Now change the IP to "127.0.0.1"
[IMG]http://i38.tinypic.com/ibjksn.jpg[/img]
Step 4) Run the client
Goto RSCDEF\rscdef\client_dist\bin
[IMG]http://i37.tinypic.com/90o9cw.jpg[/img]
again, this where you can compile and run your client
Choose what opering system you are using OR you can goto apache-ant if you have ant downloaded and extracted. (Environmental Variables needs to be set)
[IMG]http://i37.tinypic.com/30xhbpt.jpg[/img]
Hit "run"
Step 5) Make a username
Just make any username you want and login.
[IMG]http://i33.tinypic.com/zxa1yo.jpg[/img]
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Ps - If you goto apache-ant and get a "'ant' is not recognized as an internal of external command"
goto - http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,312509.msg2489922.html#msg2489922
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Hope this helps out!!

item.title: [TUT] How to run RSCDEF [TUT]
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

I wrote it to your PM, so read that… In case anyone wounders here aswell, I will provide information:

Go to com.moonsphere.rscdef.handler.ClientHandler, and down to the method register(…). In there you should find ‘Protosstribe’. Just simply change that to your name, or perhaps add a new one (up to you). Then save and compile…

Read full topic

item.title: [TUT] How to run RSCDEF [TUT]
item.dc:creator: @freaky5000 freaky5000
item.description:
@freaky5000 wrote:

I mean like, how would i make my self admin…? :S

Read full topic

item.title: [TUT] How to run RSCDEF [TUT]
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

freaky5000: No, I don’t think you can actually edit these files without expecting it to be corrupted. But I may be wrong… Anyhow, the data is serialized, and must be deserialized using the same version of the class as it was when you serialized it. If you change different things in the class that will have it deserialized, it may be out-dated. The out-dating is not guaranteed, and can work, but usually you should think of it as if it will be out-dated if making changes in that class. And the holes you were asking for; I can say that the only holes I know is that it is harder to make it usable for a highscore-table (make an Applet and Servlet for this), aswell as having multiple servers (worlds) would make it harder… You would do best in remaking the system in that case. The third con is as stated above… You should not change the class being deserialized, else it will just reset in this server-source.

Read full topic

item.title: [TUT] How to run RSCDEF [TUT]
item.dc:creator: @freaky5000 freaky5000
item.description:
@freaky5000 wrote:

Very, nice job mate. How would i go about setting up a sql database for it to start saving? Or do i not need to.

Oh, nvm I just realised it’s like the previously released Geminus, Saves to a file in the server. Is their any major security holes that i would need to worry about?

Also, noticed the save files arn’t as easy to edit to set a players “Position”, such as moderator, Admin or member.

Read full topic

item.title: [TUT] How to run RSCDEF [TUT]
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Nice tutorial… And good work!

Also, note that there is one part in the res-folder called dist. This folder is used for distribution of your client, that is, the client you will upload for people to download and play on your server. Atleast that is the purpose of it. You have to change that in order to play on your server before you even distribute it to anyone else.

Here comes a brief explanation for my folder-names:

bin: Binary, which is where all the batch-files, MAKE-files and other files for running, compiling etc. will be located.
doc: Just documentation. For instance doc/jvadocs/ will contain the Javadocs.
ext: External, meaning external libraries needed to compile and run the application.
lib: This means library, and is where the compiled files (.class-files) will be stored.
res: Resources, and is the place to put all media (images, .xml-files etc.) for your application.
src: The normal source-folder, for your source-code.

Edit: I have seen one thing you forgot to do in your tutorial… You must also run the serializer.bat file, in turn to create the Area-files, to have it load all NPCs, ground-items, ground-objects and, when implemented, even the wall-objects, when you login.

Read full topic

@adu wrote:

Alright, I am going to show you how to run RSCDEF released by ephemeral

Step 1) Compile the server.

You should end up to a screen that looks something like this.

fkru2u.jpg798×582

In here is where you compile and run your server.
